page.title: 06HORSES AND THE BLACKSMITH
page.content: A livery stable which accommodates 28 horses at present lies on the outskirts of Shareshill.As well as looking after all these horses the owner works a small arable farm,grows all his own hay and still finds the time to organise 7 horse shows every year.These include both show and jumping classes and are very popular with riders living in the Midlands.The horses in the area are well served by a blacksmith at Little Saredon.He started work there as a lad of l2 in l928 when his duties included shoeing the 36 farm horses in the area and repairing farm implements. Today he and his two assistants are responsible for shoeing 25O riding school and privately owned ponies.He also fashions hanging baskets,door knockers,bootjacks and wine racks out of disused horseshoes.
